netcal.metrics¶

Methods for measuring miscalibration. The common methods are given with the ‘Average Calibration Error (ACE)’, ‘Expected Calibration Error (ECE)’ and ‘Maximum Calibration Error (MCE)’. Each methods bins the samples by their confidence and measures the accuracy in each bin. The ECE gives the mean gap between confidence and observed accuracy in each bin weighted by the number of samples. The MCE returns the highest observed deviation. The ACE is similar to the ECE but weights each bin equally.

Available classes¶

ACE([bins, detection, sample_threshold])

Average Calibration Error (ACE).

ECE([bins, detection, sample_threshold])

Expected Calibration Error (ECE).

MCE([bins, detection, sample_threshold])

Maximum Calibration Error (MCE).
